text: Lillian Ross (Lillian Rosovsky; June 8, 1918 â€“ September 20, 2017) was an American journalist and author. She was born in Syracuse, New York. Ross was a staff writer at The New Yorker from 1945 until she retired in 2001.Profile, nytimes.com; accessed June 6, 2015. She was known for her interviews with author J. D. Salinger. Ross died from a stroke in Manhattan on September 20, 2017, at age 99. ==References== ==Other websites== * "Nothing for Lillian Ross in William Shawn's will", observer.com * "'William Shawn - stud or saint?': the memories of Lillian Ross and Ved Mehta" * Profile, nytimes.com * Profile, nymag.com * J.D.
